definition: example/mirror/to view/reflection/to reflect/to inspect/to warn/(ancient bronze mirror)
to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Even imagine yourself a connoisseur of that focus point.
sentences.chinese: 甚至想象你自己是一个鉴赏家。

sentences.english: The connoisseurs often associate it with a blackcurrant flavor.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄酒鉴赏家们通常会将它跟黑醋栗口味联系起来。

sentences.english: Become a connoisseur of the best things other people have done.
sentences.chinese: 让自己成为一个鉴赏家，鉴赏那些由他人完成的佳作。

sentences.english: He is a great appreciator of art.
sentences.chinese: 他是个伟大的艺术鉴赏家。

sentences.english: True connoisseurs, however, regard the personal preparation of tea as a special pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 真正鉴赏家常以亲自烹茶为一种殊乐。

sentences.english: Adiscerning connoisseur would have found the vase a fake .
sentences.chinese: 一个识货的鉴赏家本会发现这个古瓶是赝品。

sentences.english: The literary judge uses many evaluative terms.
sentences.chinese: 这个文学鉴赏家使用了很多评价性的术语。

sentences.english: Connoisseurs of the collection would find such crowds irritating, of course.
sentences.chinese: 艺术作品鉴赏家们当然会觉得这些人群挺讨厌。
